attempts.raw_output:
Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Real

/--
Suppose that each of $n$ people writes down the numbers $1,2,3$ in random order in one column of a $3 \times n$ matrix, with all orders equally likely and with the orders for different columns independent of each other. Let the row sums $a,b,c$ of the resulting matrix be rearranged (if necessary) so that $a \leq b \leq c$. Show that for some $n \geq 1995$, it is at least four times as likely that both $b=a+1$ and $c=a+2$ as that $a=b=c$.
-/
theorem putnam_1995_a6
(SM : (n : ℕ) → Set (Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ))
(Srowsums : (n : ℕ) → Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ → Set ℤ)
(sumsprog : (Set ℤ) → Prop)
(hSM : ∀ n, SM n = {M : Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ | ∀ j : Fin n, {M i j | i : Fin 3} = {1, 2, 3}})
(hSrowsums : ∀ n M, Srowsums n M = {∑ j : Fin n, M i j | i : Fin 3})
(hsumsprog : ∀ sums, sumsprog sums ↔ sums.encard = 3 ∧ (∃ a b c : ℤ, {a, b, c} = sums ∧ b = a + 1 ∧ c = a + 2))
: ∃ n ≥ 1995, {M : (SM n) | sumsprog (Srowsums n M)}.encard ≥ 4 * {M : (SM n) | (Srowsums n M).encard = 1}.encard :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1995_a6
(SM : (n : ℕ) → Set (Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ))
(Srowsums : (n : ℕ) → Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ → Set ℤ)
(sumsprog : (Set ℤ) → Prop)
(hSM : ∀ n, SM n = {M : Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ | ∀ j : Fin n, {M i j | i : Fin 3} = {1, 2, 3}})
(hSrowsums : ∀ n M, Srowsums n M = {∑ j : Fin n, M i j | i : Fin 3})
(hsumsprog : ∀ sums, sumsprog sums ↔ sums.encard = 3 ∧ (∃ a b c : ℤ, {a, b, c} = sums ∧ b = a + 1 ∧ c = a + 2))
: ∃ n ≥ 1995, {M : (SM n) | sumsprog (Srowsums n M)}.encard ≥ 4 * {M : (SM n) | (Srowsums n M).encard = 1}.encard := by
  have h₁ := hsumsprog ∅
  have h₂ := hsumsprog {1}
  have h₃ := hsumsprog {1, 2}
  have h₄ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 3}
  have h₅ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 4}
  have h₆ := hsumsprog {1, 3, 4}
  have h₇ := hsumsprog {2, 3, 4}
  have h₈ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 5}
  have h₉ := hsumsprog {1, 3, 5}
  have h₁₀ := hsumsprog {2, 3, 5}
  have h₁₁ := hsumsprog {1, 4, 5}
  have h₁₂ := hsumsprog {2, 4, 5}
  have h₁₃ := hsumsprog {3, 4, 5}
  norm_num at *
  <;> aesop
```

(SM : (n : ℕ) → Set (Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ))
(Srowsums : (n : ℕ) → Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ → Set ℤ)
(sumsprog : (Set ℤ) → Prop)
(hSM : ∀ n, SM n = {M : Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ | ∀ j : Fin n, {M i j | i : Fin 3} = {1, 2, 3}})
(hSrowsums : ∀ n M, Srowsums n M = {∑ j : Fin n, M i j | i : Fin 3})
(hsumsprog : ∀ sums, sumsprog sums ↔ sums.encard = 3 ∧ (∃ a b c : ℤ, {a, b, c} = sums ∧ b = a + 1 ∧ c = a + 2))

(SM : (n : ℕ) → Set (Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ))
(Srowsums : (n : ℕ) → Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ → Set ℤ)
(sumsprog : (Set ℤ) → Prop)

(hsumsprog : ∀ sums, sumsprog sums ↔ sums.encard = 3 ∧ (∃ a b c : ℤ, {a, b, c} = sums ∧ b = a + 1 ∧ c = a + 2))

(SM : (n : ℕ) → Set (Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ))

(hsumsprog : ∀ sums, sumsprog sums ↔ sums.encard = 3 ∧ (∃ a b c : ℤ, {a, b, c} = sums ∧ b = a + 1 ∧ c = a + 2))

```lean4
theorem putnam_1995_a6
(SM : (n : ℕ) → Set (Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ))
(Srowsums : (n : ℕ) → Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ → Set ℤ)
(sumsprog : (Set ℤ) → Prop)
(hSM : ∀ n, SM n = {M : Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ | ∀ j : Fin n, {M i j | i : Fin 3} = {1, 2, 3}})
(hSrowsums : ∀ n M, Srowsums n M = {∑ j : Fin n, M i j | i : Fin 3})
(hsumsprog : ∀ sums, sumsprog sums ↔ sums.encard = 3 ∧ (∃ a b c : ℤ, {a, b, c} = sums ∧ b = a + 1 ∧ c = a + 2))
: ∃ n ≥ 1995, {M : (SM n) | sumsprog (Srowsums n M)}.encard ≥ 4 * {M : (SM n) | (Srowsums n M).encard = 1}.encard := by
  have h₁ := hsumsprog ∅
  have h₂ := hsumsprog {1}
  have h₃ := hsumsprog {1, 2}
  have h₄ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 3}
  have h₅ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 4}
  have h₆ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 5}
  have h₇ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 6}
  have h₈ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 7}
  have h₉ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 8}
  have h₁₀ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 9}
  have h₁₁ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 10}
  norm_num at h₁ h₂ h₃ h₄ h₅ h₆ h₇ h₈ h₉ h₁₀ h₁₁
  <;> simp_all [Set.encard_singleton, Set.encard_univ, Set.encard_union_eq]
  <;> norm_num
  <;> use 1995
  <;> norm_num
  <;> aesop
```

```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Real

/--
Suppose that each of $n$ people writes down the numbers $1,2,3$ in random order in one column of a $3 \times n$ matrix, with all orders equally likely and with the orders for different columns independent of each other. Let the row sums $a,b,c$ of the resulting matrix be rearranged (if necessary) so that $a \leq b \leq c$. Show that for some $n \geq 1995$, it is at least four times as likely that both $b=a+1$ and $c=a+2$ as that $a=b=c$.
-/
theorem putnam_1995_a6
(SM : (n : ℕ) → Set (Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ))
(Srowsums : (n : ℕ) → Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ → Set ℤ)
(sumsprog : (Set ℤ) → Prop)
(hSM : ∀ n, SM n = {M : Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ | ∀ j : Fin n, {M i j | i : Fin 3} = {1, 2, 3}})
(hSrowsums : ∀ n M, Srowsums n M = {∑ j : Fin n, M i j | i : Fin 3})
(hsumsprog : ∀ sums, sumsprog sums ↔ sums.encard = 3 ∧ (∃ a b c : ℤ, {a, b, c} = sums ∧ b = a + 1 ∧ c = a + 2))
: ∃ n ≥ 1995, {M : (SM n) | sumsprog (Srowsums n M)}.encard ≥ 4 * {M : (SM n) | (Srowsums n M).encard = 1}.encard :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1995_a6
(SM : (n : ℕ) → Set (Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ))
(Srowsums : (n : ℕ) → Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ → Set ℤ)
(sumsprog : (Set ℤ) → Prop)
(hSM : ∀ n, SM n = {M : Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ | ∀ j : Fin n, {M i j | i : Fin 3} = {1, 2, 3}})
(hSrowsums : ∀ n M, Srowsums n M = {∑ j : Fin n, M i j | i : Fin 3})
(hsumsprog : ∀ sums, sumsprog sums ↔ sums.encard = 3 ∧ (∃ a b c : ℤ, {a, b, c} = sums ∧ b = a + 1 ∧ c = a + 2))
: ∃ n ≥ 1995, {M : (SM n) | sumsprog (Srowsums n M)}.encard ≥ 4 * {M : (SM n) | (Srowsums n M).encard = 1}.encard := by
  have h₁ := hsumsprog ∅
  have h₂ := hsumsprog {1}
  have h₃ := hsumsprog {1, 2}
  have h₄ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 3}
  have h₅ := hsumsprog {1, 2, 3, 4}
  norm_num [Set.encard_eq_zero] at h₁ h₂ h₃ h₄ h₅
  <;>
  use 1995
  <;>
  norm_num
  <;>
  aesop
```

theorem putnam_1995_a6
(SM : (n : ℕ) → Set (Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ))
(Srowsums : (n : ℕ) → Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ → Set ℤ)
(sumsprog : (Set ℤ) → Prop)
(hSM : ∀ n, SM n = {M : Matrix (Fin 3) (Fin n) ℤ | ∀ j : Fin n, {M i j | i : Fin 3} = {1, 2, 3}})
(hSrowsums : ∀ n M, Srowsums n M = {∑ j : Fin n, M i j | i : Fin 3})
(hsumsprog : ∀ sums, sumsprog sums ↔ sums.encard = 3 ∧ (∃ a b c : ℤ, {a, b, c} = sums ∧ b = a + 1 ∧ c = a + 2))
: ∃ n ≥ 1995, {M : (SM n) | sumsprog (Srowsums n M)}.encard ≥ 4 * {M : (SM n) | (Srowsums n M).encard = 1}.encard := by
  have h₁ := hsumsprog ∅
  have h₂ := hsumsprog {0}
  have h₃ := hsumsprog {1}
  have h₄ := hsumsprog {2}
  have h₅ := hsumsprog {3}
  have h₆ := hsumsprog {4}
  have h₇ := hsumsprog {5}
  have h₈ := hsumsprog {6}

  <;> simp_all [Set.encard_eq_zero]
  <;> use 1995
  <;> norm_num
